database.description: Database initial connection will be made too.

password.description: Password used to connect to the Denodo platform.

ssl_mode.description: SSL mode used to connect to the Denodo platform. Acceptable values disable, allow, prefer, require

username.description: Username used to connect to the Denodo platform.

data_source_catalog_name.description: Name of the catalog in the source database that contains the table from which to create the base view. Pass null if the database does not support catalogs.

data_source_database.description: Name of the database to which the JDBC data source belongs.

data_source_schema_name.description: Name of the schema in the source database that contains the table from which to create the base view. Pass null if the database does not support schemas.

data_source_table_name.description: Name of the table/view over which to create the base view.

database.description: Database where the base view will reside.

folder.description: Folder in which to place the created base view. The result will include the VQL statements to create this folder(s). If null, the VQL will not specify a folder.

name.description: Name of the base view to be created. If null, the name will be auto-generated.

authentication.description: Authenication method the database will use.

char_set.description: Setting the charset. Valid values are UNICODE, RESTRICTED, or DEFAULT.

check_view_restrictions.description: The section Column Privileges, Row Restrictions and Custom Policies Are Always Propagated of the Upgrade Guide explains the implications of changing this parameter.

cost_optimization.description: Enables or disables the cost-based optimization on this database.

name.description: Name of the database to be created.

odbc_authentication.description: ODBC Authenication method it will use. Valid values are NORMAL or KERBEROS.

query_simplification.description: Enables or disables automatic simplification of queries on the database. Valid values are ON, OFF, or DEFAULT.

summary_rewrite.description: Enables or disables the summary rewrite optimization on the database. Valid values are ON, OFF, or DEFAULT.

move.description: Indicator to move an element to the folder.

rename_path.description: When the data source has to insert several rows into the database of this data source, it can insert them in batches. This number sets the number of queries per batch.

all_privileges.description: All privileges CONNECT, CREATE, CREATE_DATA_SOURCE, CREATE_VIEW, CREATE_DATA_SERVICE, CREATE_FOLDER, EXECUTE, METADATA, WRITE, and FILE.

create.description: Create privilege for all objects in a database.

create_data_service.description: Create data service privilege in a database.

create_data_source.description: Create data source privilege in a database.

create_folder.description: Create folder privilege in a database.

create_view.description: Create view privilege in a database.

database_name.description: Name of the database the role belongs too.

execute.description: Execute privilege on objects in a database.

file.description: File privilege in a database to browse through directories.

meta_data.description: Metadata privilege to get view information in the database.

monitor_admin.description: Monitoring admin role on the database.

name.description: Name of the role being created.

scheduler_admin.description: Scheduling admin role on the database.

write.description: Write privileges on elements in a database.

database.description: Database where the base view will reside.

directory.description: Directory (or directories) with the sql files containing VQL to create or replace dervived views.

batch_insert_size.description: When the data source has to insert several rows into the database of this data source, it can insert them in batches. This number sets the number of queries per batch.

bcp_executable_location.description: When the data source has to insert several rows into the database of this data source, it can insert them in batches. This number sets the number of queries per batch.

class_path.description: Path to the JAR file containing the JDBC driver for the specified source (optional).

data_source_description.description: The description of the data source.

database_uri.description: The connection URL to the database.

denodo_database.description: Database where the data source will be created.

driver_class_name.description: The driver class to be used for connection to the data source.

exhausted_action.description: Specifies the behavior of the pool when the pool is empty (all the connections are running queries). (Default value: 1)

fetch_size.description: Gives the JDBC driver a hint as to the number of rows that should be fetched from the database when more rows are needed.

folder.description: Name of the folder where the data source will be stored.

ignore_trailing_spaces.description: If true, the Server removes the space characters at the end of text type values of the results returned by these data source’s views.

initial_size.description: Number of connections with which the pool is initialized. (default value: 4)

isolation_level.description: Sets the desired isolation level for the queries and transactions executed in the database. If not present, the data source uses the default isolation level of the database.

jdbc_driver_properties.description: List of name/value pairs that will be passed to the JDBC driver when creating connection with this database.

kerberos_properties.description: List of name/value pairs that will be passed to the JDBC driver when creating connection with this database. The properties on this list are meant to configure the Kerberos authentication mechanism between the Virtual DataPort server and the database.

max_active.description: Maximum number of connections that can be opened at a given time. These are the connections currently used to run queries plus the connections idle in the pool. (default value: 20)

max_idle.description: Maximum number of connections that can sit idle in the pool at any time. (default value: -1)

max_open_prepared_statements.description: Maximum number of opened prepared statements. Only taken into account if POOLPREPAREDSTATEMENTS is true.

min_evictable_time.description: Minimum amount of time in milliseconds that a connection may sit idle in the pool before it is eligible for eviction. (default value: 1800000 - 30 minutes)

name.description: Name of the data source to be created.

number_test_per_eviction.description: Number of connections examined in each run of the connection eviction thread. The reason for not examining all the connections of the pool in each run of the thread is because while a connection is being examined, it cannot be used by a query. (default value: 3)

on_move_read.description: if true, when the Execution Engine reads data from the Netezza database to perform a data movement, it will do so using its “External tables” feature. Setting this to true is equivalent to selecting the check box “Use external tables for data movement” of the “Read settings”, on the “Read & Write” tab of the data source

on_move_write.description: if true, when the Execution Engine writes data to this database to perform a data movement, it does so using its proprietary API. Setting this to yes is equivalent to selecting the check box “Use Bulk Data Load APIs” of the “Write settings”, on the “Read & Write” tab of the data source.

password.description: Password to connect to the data source.

pool_prepared_statements.description: if true, the pool of prepared statements is enabled.

sql_ldr_executable_location.description: SQLDR executable location to use bulk data load APIs. (Oracle)

target_catalog.description: Target catalog to use for bulk load api work.

target_schema.description: Target schema to use for bulk load api work.

test_on_borrow.description: if true and the parameter VALIDATIONQUERY is not empty, the pool will execute the VALIDATIONQUERY on the selected connection before returning it to the execution engine. If the VALIDATIONQUERY fails, the pool will discard the connection and select another one. If there are no more idle connections, it will create one. (default value: true)

test_on_return.description: if true and the parameter VALIDATIONQUERY is not empty, the pool will execute the VALIDATIONQUERY on the connections returned to the pool. If the VALIDATIONQUERY fails, the pool will discard the connection. (default value: false)

test_while_idle.description: If true and the parameter VALIDATIONQUERY is not empty, the connections will be validated by the connection eviction thread. To validate a connection, the thread runs the validation query on the connection. If it fails, the pool drops the connection from the pool. (default value: false)

time_between_eviction.description: How long in milliseconds the eviction thread should sleep before “runs” of examining idle connections. If negative, the eviction thread is not launched. (default value: -1)

use_for_query_optimization.description: Data load configuration to optimize for data movement workload.

username.description: Username to connect to the data source.

validation_query.description: SQL query executed by the connection pool to check if a connection is still valid; also known as “ping query”. It is only used when at least one of TESTONBORROW, TESTONRETURN or TESTWHILEIDLE are true. (default value: depends on the adapter)

work_dir.description: Work directory used by bulk load configuration. (Oracle only)

catalog_name.description: Name of the catalog for which you want to get the list of tables. If the data source does not support catalogs, set to null. If null and the data source does support catalogs, the procedure will return all the matching tables across all catalogs.

database.description: Name of the database to which the data source belongs. If null, the procedure will use the current database.

name.description: Name of the data source for which you want to get the list of tables.

schema_name.description: When the data source has to insert several rows into the database of this data source, it can insert them in batches. This number sets the number of queries per batch.

object_type.description: Type of object to retrieve. Folders, DataSources, StoredProcedures, Wrappers, Views, WebServices, Widgets, Associations, JMSListeners
